title: How to Edit or Remove a Posted Review on Yelp

steps.title: Decide how much of the review you'd like to edit or change.
steps.content: Decide how much of the review you'd like to edit or change. If it's so much that complete removal is needed, a separate button that is located on all reviews will be needed.

steps.title: Try to determine why these edits need to be made to the review.
steps.content: Try to determine why these edits need to be made to the review. Maybe it's something simple, or maybe it's too complex to describe in a few words, or maybe things just changed and you've seen a new experience first hand, determine this reason. Write a Review Update on Yelp can help you make some changes to updated reviews/changed reviews in your experience.

steps.title: Visit the Yelp web page.
steps.content: Visit the Yelp web page .

steps.title: Click the "About Me" tab, from the Yelp home page.
steps.content: Click the "About Me" tab, from the Yelp home page. From this page, you'll see your reviews.

steps.title: Scroll down to the bottom of the page and click the white button(with red lettering) that says "More", if the review is not found on this page.
steps.content: Scroll down to the bottom of the page and click the white button(with red lettering) that says "More", if the review is not found on this page. As you roll through page after page, the more visualized buttons will turn into "More" hyperlink (non-visualized links). Click "Next" to advance to the next page. If you need to back up a page, at the top and bottom of each part of the page, you'll also find a hyperlink marked "Previous". Click this button to go to the previous listing of reviews you've written.

steps.title: Find the corresponding link to the review you'd like to edit.
steps.content: Find the corresponding link to the review you'd like to edit.

steps.title: Click the hamburger menu.
steps.content: Click the hamburger menu.

steps.title: Recognize some editing time restrictions placed in 2017.
steps.content: Recognize some editing time restrictions placed in 2017. As of 2017, you can only edit reviews within a 24-hour window after the review was posted, and if you are out of that time, too bad; remove the review and start over, if you have a new experience that's reviewable on Yelp. If you need to review a new experience because your recent encounter changed it (either good or bad), write a fresh new review update instead. Editing reviews is for making more minor changes or continuing on the experience that you might have missed from the same experience.

steps.title: Click "Edit review".
steps.content: Click "Edit review".

steps.title: Edit the review.
steps.content: Edit the review. Fix all the things that need to be fixed.

steps.title: Click "Post" after your edit is complete.
steps.content: Click "Post" after your edit is complete.

steps.title: Click the "Remove review" button if you would rather like to remove the full review instead.
steps.content: Click the "Remove review" button if you would rather like to remove the full review instead.

steps.title: Choose why you are removing the review.
steps.content: Choose why you are removing the review. You're choices are "I was threatened with legal action or sued.", "I was threatened with legal action or sued.", "I signed a contract with the business that requires me to remove this review.", "I changed my opinion of this business after a new interaction." or "Other". Click the Continue button on their mobile platform page to advance to the next step.

steps.title: Write a brief summary of why you are removing it in the box marked "Can you provide additional information about your situation."
steps.content: Write a brief summary of why you are removing it in the box marked "Can you provide additional information about your situation." You'll find this box underneath the five removal choices. You'll need to write more than just "removing the review," to indicate why you are removing your review.

steps.title: Click the "Remove Review" button just below that box.
steps.content: Click the "Remove Review" button just below that box.
